contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Nuclear weapons test |name = Upshot-Knothole Simon |picture = Upshot-Knothole Simon 001.jpg |picture_description = |country = United States |test_series = [[Operation Upshot-Knothole]] |test_site = [[Nevada Test Site]] |date = April 25, 1953 |test_type = [[Nuclear weapons testing#Types|Atmospheric]] |yield = 43 [[TNT equivalent|kt]] }} '''Upshot-Knothole Simon''' was a nuclear detonation conducted as part of the [[United States|U.S.]] [[Operation Upshot-Knothole]] nuclear testing program. Simon was conducted on 25 April 1953 at the [[Nevada Test Site]], and tested the TX-17/24 thermonuclear weapon design which had a yield of 43 kilotons. :Test: Simon :Time: 12:30 25 April 1953 (GMT) :04:30 25 April 1953 (local) :Location: Nevada Test Site, [[Area 1 (Nevada National Security Site)|Area 1]] :Test Height and Type: 300 Foot Tower :Yield: 43 kt ==External links== * [http://www.radiochemistry.org/history/nuke_tests/upshot_knothole/ Documentation of Operation Upshot-Knothole] {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{Nuclear weapons tests of the United States}} [[Category:American nuclear explosive tests]] [[Category:1953 in the United States]] [[Category:Nevada Test Site]] {{Weapon-stub}}
